comment: Grades 3 Unit Tests and one cumulative final. He gives a quiz per unit but they are not for a grade. His lectures were not really that beneficial if you look at the PowerPoints because he did not add his own commentary and kind of just read the slides. He has a thick Italian accent that makes it really difficult to understand.

Super nice professor. 3 tests and one final exam. Practices quizzes and problem sets are identical to actual test. Classes can get boring because he talks the whole time. The graphs and vocab you have to learn yourself because he does not explain them. Overall, memorize study materials and you will pass. Would take again and recommend!
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Nice teacher, test and attendance based class. You rlly have to go to class once a week and scan the code. Test are exactly like the quizzes and problem sets. no homework or anything. he is really nice too so thats a plus. recommend him if you just need to pass the class.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Very amazing professor. Can tell he truly cares about his students and wants them to succeed. He encourages participation and allows you to earn credit by just answering questions in class. Constantly asks to make sure we are okay with the material before we move on. No homework, practice sets, and quizzes are exactly like the tests.

I love this professor! His lectures can be drawn out but he truly cares about his students. If I ever had any questions he was quick to help me understand. His tests are the exact same as the problem sets and quizzes. Do the problem sets and quizzes multiple times and you should be fine.

Only grades are tests and participation/attendance. But the tests are soooo easy if you just study the practice sets the day before, they are basically identical. A fair teacher and is nice. He also gives extra points on the exam for difficulty (but it's not difficult at all so basically free extra points!!) Would def take again. Easy A
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: very caring a nice guy. Lectures are long and boring. Found it difficult to pay attention. easier to just learn from posted quizzes and problem sets. Whole grade is attendance + like 3 tests. As long as you can memorize and teach yourself you'll be fine.

Took him for macro in the spring. He is a super great professor and if you reach out to him, he will be very open to working with you and explaining unclear concept. His lectures are kind of long and boring, but his powerpoint slides are very useful. There's only 4 exams, but they're almost an exact copy of the study guide/quizzes so just memorize.

Super easy A, the only grades are attendance (super flexible with it so not really a grade) and the tests. His tests are exact copies of his ungraded quizzes and problem sets to which he provides the answers. Genuinely a super great and caring professor.

He's a nice professor who is genuinely passionate about the subject and encourages questions/participation. The lectures have lots of info but If you are good at memorizing things you'll do great since the practice materials he gives are all you rly need to focus on for the tests. Lots of extra points are given too.

Attendance might be mandatory but you really need to just email him your name a few times when he asks and that's it for semester attendance. The only things graded are like three tests and an exam, all of which are easy if you review the problem sets and quizzes he gives you. Some of the material is a little dry but he's great and passionate.

I do not like anything econ related. But Occhino found a way to make his class very simple! His lectures can be long, but he is very caring & silly! He truly wants his students to succeed. The only grades are 4 tests, but if you look over problem sets and study past quizzes, they are easy As. He also provides extra credit to those who come to class

He was okay. Class consisted of 3 exams and a final, no graded assignments in between. His class was extremely boring so majority of the class just showed up for the exams. If you review the problem sets and practice quizzes before the exam you will be good. Have to email your name every once in a while to show that you have attended class.

Professor Occhino is a solid option for Econ 2105. His lectures are not very interesting, but the problem sets and online quizzes (not graded) are very helpful. If you study those two items, you will do very well on the tests.  If you are not a great test taker, you may want to consider a different professor, but I would still recommend him 100%.

PLEASE TAKE A DIFFERENT PROFESSOR!! His lectures are BORING AND COMPLICATED. It doesn't help that he expects you to participate in class even though most people don't know what is going on! Only graded by 4 TESTS and PARTICIPATION. He gives the material to prepare for the tests, but you will have to teach it to yourself bc he doesn't teach right.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: One of my easiest classes. As long as you complete and review the problem sets a day before the tests you should be fine. The only taken grades are the 4 exams.

DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS FOR YOUR OWN SAKE. HE LEAVES THE ENTIRE CLASS CONFUSED DURING LECTURES AND DOESN'T PROVIDE ANY ALTERNATIVE GRADED ASSIGNMENTS TO TURN IN. YOU RELY ON 4 EXAM GRADES TO PASS THE CLASS. NO HOMEWORK, NO EXTRA CREDIT, JUST EXAMS. IF YOU FAIL ONE, YOU'RE BASICALLY DOOMED!!!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: His lectures were pretty confusing. Exams are 1/2 problem sets (optional homework, definitely go over them because they're basically on the tests word for word) and 1/2 conceptual stuff from his PowerPoints. He also curved our grades heavily (out of 230 points total, he gave us 18 bonus points and then another 13 bonus points at the end).

He is a nice guy, but unless you have a natural understanding of economics, do not take his course. Your only grades consist of four exams. Other than that, you are on your own. His way of explaining things is like trying to read in zig zags. Dont take.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Goatcchino, everyone who said he is hard is lying. All you have to do to get an A is the problem sets, and review the slides. You don't have to buy the textbook, there was no homework. He gave a straight 12% curve to every test.
Goat Professor, do the problem sets and you'll be fine
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Challenging, fair. We  learn about interest rates, banks, stress test. Pretty cool and he helped me learn about the economy. I liked his speakers. Tests are hard though. You will have to put time in.

terrible teacher, smart guy just doesnt know how to teach so you figure out a lot on your own, only grades by 4 tests, he curves them a lot though but you wont know like half of it, in person testing but take it on your laptop or phone (iykyk).
